column4: ** (gnome-language-selector:3223): CRITICAL **: menu_proxy_module_load: assertion `dbusproxy != NULL' failedSegmentation fault  > How do i fix this error that occurs when opening gnomelanguage selector.
you might have stumble into a bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/indicator-appmenu/+bug/594877
I have not done anything today , so how i got the bug from nowhere ? :(
that's why it's called a bug: ie, unwanted behavior :(
and it can come all suddenly and from nowhere ? !! !! Ok. I am going to try uninstalling appmenu gtk as said in the launchpad page
Somehting changed somewhere but it might not be your fault...

I cannot use SCIM and parcellite. They both appear on the tray but if i click they kill themselves and restart themselves (!!) .. I also tried killing scim from the task manager many times. Every time i kill it , it restarts.. A VIRUS , it behaves like A VIRUS.
task manager = system monitor. Sorry, i am new to buntu from windows and i am not used to the naming system ;-)
and you probably need SCIM
I have scim installed. TO type in tamil, hindi, telugu... It has been working for a week (i installed scim a week ago)
do you know why scim acts like a virus? every time i kill scim from sys monitor, It just restarts itself.. I tried right click > kill , right click > kill over seventy times :P
because it is restarted by the system. Something is probably depending on it
thanks for replying......! B-)
it's not actually "killed"... it's probably crashing
even if i "Kill" from system monitor, It restarts ;-)
yeah, like I said: something is restarting it because, as a user you probalby have something depending on it.
you = ubuntu ?
Too much of hassles for a complete beginner like i am.
me == everything :)
thanks to you too .
abhi_nav after adding ibus daemon to start up, The language support in preferences also work , too.
